document.masterDocTitle: A taxonomic monograph of the Middle American leaf-litter inhabiting weevil genus Theognete Champion (Coleoptera: Curculionidae; Molytinae; Lymantini) 2458

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A taxonomic monograph of the Middle American leaf-litter inhabiting weevil genus Theognete Champion (Coleoptera: Curculionidae; Molytinae; Lymantini) 2458

subSubSection.paragraph:
93.
Theognete grimblyae Anderson
, new species
( Figures 297 , 306 , 315 )

Diagnosis. Size. Length, male, 2.94–3.20mm ; female, 2.68–3.55mm . Width, male, 1.70–1.79mm ; female, 1.62–2.04mm . As for
T. hesmos
but pronotum less strongly cordate, without trace of median carina or swelling. Elytra with scales suberect to erect, fine, simple, slightly recurved at apex. Aedeagus as in Fig. 306 .
Natural history . Collected from berlese extraction of cloud forest leaf litter at elevations ranging from 1620–1790m .
Derivation of specific name . Through his support of the Nature Discovery Fund at the Canadian Museum of Nature, named after Susan Grimbly of Toronto, Ontario , Canada , as a gift from Ian Pearson.

Material examined .
64♂ , 56♀♀ ( BMNH , CMNC , CWOB , ECOS , UAQM , USNM )
.
Holotype ♂ ( CMNC )
